channel.title: Architecture on Gerald Nguyen
channel.description: Recent content in Architecture on Gerald Nguyen

item.title: Consistency in framework design
item.description: Concistency Framework: a set of ideas, principles, agreements, or rules that provides the basis or outline for something intended to be more fully developed at a later stage (MSN Dictionary) Not sure if you agree, but for me, the above definition implies “consistency” as a essential effect of using a framework. In the context of software development, using a framework usually equals to following its design guideline, or implementing/extending its interfaces/base classes.
